title: Sewage and Developing Nations
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sewage and Developing Nations usable.

hook.text: 80% of the world's wastewater flows back into rivers and oceans completely untreated.

buildup.text: In low-income countries, fewer than 8% of households are connected to sewer systems.

discovery.text: Raw sewage carries cholera, typhoid, and parasites that kill hundreds of thousands per year.

twist.text: Building conventional sewer systems is so expensive that most developing cities can't afford them.
